justification: The authors state that “One task that allows us to assess the effects of internal attention on WM contents (i.e. retrospective attention) is the retro-cueing paradigm (Griffin & Nobre, 2003).”

measured_by: drift rate (v) parameter of the hierarchical drift-diffusion model
justification: In describing the modelling, the paper notes that “the drift rate parameter (v) serv[es] as an indicator of the quality of WM representations.”

measured_by: non-decision time (t0) parameter of the hierarchical drift-diffusion model
justification: The same section explains that “the non-decision time parameter (t0) represent[s] the time required for WM retrieval.”
The authors report that “voluntary attention elicits both benefits and costs on accuracy and/or reaction times (RTs)… the sum of both sub-effects being the retro-cue effect (RCE).”
construct: benefits and costs of voluntary and involuntary internal attention
